page.title: 04BIRD RESERVES
page.content:
BIRD RESERVES IN SILVERDALE
The Royal Society for the Protection of Birds (RSPB) has two reserves in Silverdale. One is the area of salt marsh adjoining Silverdale but the main one is at Leighton Moss with a Vistor Centre at Myers Farm. Leighton Moss is an area of freshwater lagoons and reed beds which reformed when pumping of the marsh land ceased during the 1914-18 War. Observations have shown that over 170 varieties of birds are residents or regular vistors to the reserve. In addition 45 other species have been recorded as rare visitors. Amongst the permanent residents are the bittern and a colony of heron. A regular visitor is the osprey.
